page.title: 03INDUSTRY FORDS BOREHAM 1
page.content: Until the Second World War much of the area to the North of Boreham Village was woodland or farmland.Then about 630 Acres were cleared to build an airfield. This was used by the American Airforce to launch Marauders (Fighter Bombers). The airfield, one of many built at that time in East Anglia, was not needed for its original purpose when peace had been declared. It was first used as a race track (Mike Hawthorn holds the track record) but although the terrain was ideal for racing, access to the site was difficult,and the race track was short lived. Next the site was used by the County Council,who were the owners, for storage purposes.The large hanger being particularly suitable for this.
